III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 The section on the treatment plan asking for the reason this facility is an
appropriate placement should have information specific to the facility/program
that is meeting the youth’s specific identified needs.
 Room check logs for sleeping hours should have the staff checking initial each
time a check is completed, rather than signing at the end of the shift.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consolation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this licensing
period.
The facility provided copies of all the incident reports (fifteen) occurring during this
reporting period. The facility also contacted the licensing Consultant each time an
incident occurred. These incidents involved, youth on youth aggression, AWOL,
police contact, hospitalization, and destruction of property. These incident reports
were reviewed, and it appears that the facility was attentive and provided the
appropriate actions to ensure the youth’s safety and security. Several safety plans
were developed which included involving the school the youth attended.
Chief Administrator Assessment
There were no required corrective action plans during this reporting period. However,
the report notes the facility had one unplanned discharge. The youth had completed
the program, but since no aftercare placement was established, this youth began
4

decompensating and was hospitalized and transitioned to an inpatient facility. This
youth was 17 years old and had been in placement for approximately 12-months
before this incident. The Chief Administrator identified several actions step to ensure
staff are aware of any decompensation of youth and share this information with
administration who will share with the referral source. This will also be an issue that is
addressed during the quarterly FTM meetings, and the Director of Youth Services will
speak to each youth weekly to assess their functioning. These contacts will be
documented and shared with the Chief Administrator. The goal is to avoid any future
unplanned discharges, especially of this nature. The facility will also request weekly
updates when a youth is ready for discharge and before they show signs of
decompensation. The facility will assist the youth in seeking community placement
options as they are nearing the successful completion of their program.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted will all the youth currently in the program. They report
feeling safe and benefiting from the program. Each shared a positive interaction with
staff and attending therapy sessions weekly. The youth who had been involved in
incident reports, were able to identify their safety plans and how these plans helped.
Staff interviewed reported a strong desire to perform best practice with the youth and
believe they are supported by the administration. Each were able to identify their
training, especially with a focus on trauma. The supervisors and administration staff
interviewed reported some frustration with the struggles in the presenting problems in
some youth but believe they have been successful in providing a level of open
treatment care that is beneficial to the youth.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
